intro: Mimosa conferta var. guaranitica, commonly known as the Brazilian sensitive plant, is a shrub native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It features compound leaves that are sensitive to touch, folding inward when disturbed. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often followed by fluffy, white seed pods. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil. Due to its sensitivity and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a decorative plant.
